projects.title: Initiative Tracker
projects.description: In tabletop role-playing games such as Dungeons and Dragons, it is often useful to have a tool to keep track of the order of combat turns, also known as "initiative". Many such tools exist, but I wanted to try making my own. To keep the scale of the project manageable, I designed a minimal text-based user interface that allows users to add and remove turns, display them in order, and step through turns individually.
projects.alt-text: A screenshot of a terminal running the text-based Initative Tracker tool.

projects.title: Shape Quest
projects.description: In spring 2023, I took a software development class at Vassar College (Computer Science III: Software Design and Implementation) that focused on Android development in groups. My partner for the course, Caroline Semel, and I designed, developed, and tested different iterations of our project until we reached the final result: a fully functional combat/adventure game in the form of an Android application.
projects.alt-text: A screenshot of the app running on Android Studio's emulator.

projects.title: Portfolio Website
projects.description: I created a personal portfolio website (oliverhalberg.com) using React to showcase my experience and projects. Using example code from Treehouse courses as reference material, I designed, created, and styled the custom React components I needed to assemble the website.
projects.altText: A screenshot of the home page of this website.

projects.title: Initiative Tracker (GUI)
projects.description: I revisited my earlier Initiative Tracker project, upgrading it to have a graphical user interface and some improved functionality. For this new version, I rewrote the logic in JavaScript and used custom React components to create a front end for the project. Since I wanted the tool to be accessible offline, I used the Electron framework to create a desktop app for the project and packaged it for distribution using Electron Builder. This project is currently undergoing beta testing. Development is ongoing, and new features will be added over the next few weeks as I work towards a full release.
projects.alt-text: A screenshot of the app's beta layout, showing an example turn order.
